feed.title: ISOBlue 2.0 Blog
feed.subtitle: The best place to stay up-to-date with the latest ISOBlue 2.0 news and events.

entry.title: DPAC Experiment
entry.summary: On a rather cold, chilly, and windy April afternoon, I drove to [Davis Purdue Agricultural Center (DPAC)][1] along with my colleague, Matt to collect some machine data.

entry.title: Houston, we have a problem
entry.summary: We have built 5 ISOBlue 2.0s and they are up and running when they need to. Since we are not necessarily product design or mechanical design experts, we try our best to fit ISOBlue inside a weatherproof enclosure with all the connectors and antennas sticking out.

entry.title: New ISOBlue Site
entry.summary: As you could see, we have made some renovations to the ISOBlue website. Projects like ISOBlue is constantly changing and adapting to the newest and hotest trends in open-source community in terms of Cloud architecture tools, build tools, hardware, etc. It will be helpful for both you and us to get informed with the latest status of ISOBlue.

entry.title: CANdroid During a Manure Spreading Session
entry.summary: We utilized CANdroid to collect ISOBUS data during a manure spreading session. The session lasted for about 2 hours with a total of 6 passes of manure spreading in the field.
